intro: Cytheraea dulcis, commonly known as the orange-brown swallowtail. This plant is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and distinctive leaf structures. It produces small, yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has a taproot system and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in open habitats like meadows and woodland edges.
